W. K. KELLOGG FOUNDATION
250 CHAMPION STREET
BATTLE CREEK, MICHIGAN
DIVISION OF EDUCATION
MAURICE F. SEAY
DIRECTOR
August 11, 1959
PHONE WO
received
NAEB HEADQUARTERS
AUG 12 1959
Mr. Harry J. Skomia, Exec. Director
Nat*l. Ass’n. of Educational Broadcasters
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
m p w
?l «l »l 10i 1,1112,1; 2,8| 4| 6|6
t
Dear Harry:
The question of relocating the headquarters of the NAEB is one ’which
does not affect the commitment which we have with your Association.
Fortunately, the commitment is now made direct to the Association.
Therefore, a move to Washington would not bring about any complica¬
tions of sponsorship.
On the other hand, we would like to be informed concerning your reason¬
ing with respect to this question. As you suggest, there may be time
when we are in Washington for the TV conference for an initial dis¬
cussion of this matter. Later on we would be glad to have you and
Dr. Harley come by to see us if such a visit seems important.
Thanks for counting me in on the hotel reservations at the DuPont Plaza.
As I check my travel schedule for the fall, I have decided to attend
your convention from October 27 to 29, arriving the afternoon of the
27th and leaving the afternoon of the 29th. I am sending in the hotel
reservation slip which you sent to me. Thanks a lot for your help.
Sincerely and with best wishes.
Maurice F. Seay
MFS/fh
